page.title: 04POLICING IN MORDIFORD
page.content: In the areas surrounding Mordiford there is one local policeman - P.C. Williams. The local Police Station is run single handedly from Bartestree, two miles away. West Mercia Police see the main function of village and rural policing as providing a law and order presence that villagers can rely upon and trust. However approximately two hundred crimes occur each year in the D-Block, mostly involving criminal damage and burglaries. The age group that causes most problems is that between sixteen and twenty years. A problem particular to this area is poaching which occurs mainly in Haugh Woods and along the River Wye, the prime targets being deer and salmon respectively.
